intro: Aster italicus, commonly known as the Italian aster, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Aster italicus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
